official_title: A Decisional Intervention for Older Adults With Acute Myeloid Leukemia and Their Caregivers
inclusion_criteria:
Patients

Inclusion criteria:

* Age â‰¥60 years (from date of consent, confirmed on electronic medical records)
* A diagnosis of AML

  * Diagnosis can be based on the International Consensus Classification or World Health Organization
  * Myeloid sarcoma is allowed
* Cancer-directed treatment has not started (e.g., hydroxyurea, leukopheresis, or treatment to temporarily decrease white blood cells is acceptable)
* The patient's oncologist has been or will be enrolled on the study
* English or Spanish-speaking
* Patients without a caregiver will still be eligible to participate in the study

Exclusion criteria

* A diagnosis of acute promyelocytic leukemia
* Patients with psychiatric or cognitive conditions which the treating oncologist believes prohibits informed consent or compliance with study procedures
* Prior cancer-directed treatment for AML (hydroxyurea is acceptable)

Caregivers

Inclusion criteria:

* Selected by the patient when asked if there is a "family member, partner, friend or caregiver [age 18 or older] with whom you discuss or who can be helpful in health-related matters."
* Caregiver may be paid/professional or informal caregiver
* Able to provide informed consent
* English or Spanish-speaking
* Caregiver may enroll any time before the patient's next clinical visit with the oncologist, following the completion of procedures in either the UR-GOAL intervention or attention control arms

Oncologists

Inclusion criteria:

* Oncologists caring for patients with AML Exclusion criteria
* None
Healthy volunteers allowed
Must have minimum age of 60 Years
